thread.title: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs
thread.title_full: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs

title: Kershaw, Dodgers facing different Mets in playoffs
text:
Kershaw and Dodgers facing new-look Mets in Game 1 of NL Division Series By BETH HARRIS AP Sports Writer   5:53   5:53   
People: 
New York (1742) 

LOS ANGELES â€” Clayton Kershaw isn't sure what to expect from the new-look Mets, whose dramatic transformation in the second half of the season led to them winning the NL East title. 
The Los Angeles Dodgers ace faced a mostly different New York lineup before the July trade deadline. Even veteran Mets infielder David Wright was out at the time. 
The Dodgers aren't the same team that got chased out of the NL Division Series by St. Louis a year ago, either. They shipped out Matt Kemp, Hanley Ramirez and Juan Uribe, and ushered in veterans Jimmy Rollins, Howie Kendrick and Yasmani Grandal. 
When Kershaw takes the mound for Friday night's opener at Dodger Stadium, he'll be trying to earn just the second postseason win of his career after going 0-4 in his last two series against the Cardinals.
